meanings.definition: A papal letter sent to all bishops of the Roman Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: The bishop received an encyclic from the Pope.
meanings.sent2: The encyclic addressed important matters within the Church.
meanings.sent3: The encyclic was so long, the bishop joked about needing extra time to read it.
meanings.sent4: The encyclic served as a guiding light for the bishops.
meanings.sent5: The encyclic's words echoed through the halls of the cathedral.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an encyclical.
meanings.sent1: The encyclic language used in the letter was formal and respectful.
meanings.sent2: Her encyclic tone conveyed a sense of authority.
meanings.sent3: The encyclic decorations in the room added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent4: His encyclic mannerisms mirrored those of a seasoned diplomat.
meanings.sent5: The encyclic style of writing was clear and informative.
